abstract: Conservationists warn endangered species could be threatened by proposed changes to China's Wildlife Protection Law; draft revision, which includes several provisions activists praise, also loosens or removes regulations on commercial exploitation of wild animals and shifts oversight from central government to less accountable provincial authorities.
lead_paragraph: A proposed revision makes explicit that endangered species are “natural resources” that can be legally bred in captivity for commercial purposes.

headline.main: Exploitation of Endangered Species Feared as China Revisits Wildlife Law
headline.print_headline: Fears for Endangered Species as China Revisits Law

snippet: A proposed revision makes explicit that endangered species are “natural resources” that can be legally bred in captivity for commercial purposes.
